intro: Minuartia skorpilii, commonly known as the Skorpil's rock-cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant typically grows on rocky slopes and in dry, well-drained soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and bloom in early summer. Minuartia skorpilii is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
